properties.areaDesc: Delaware, OK; Cherokee, OK; Mayes, OK; Wagoner, OK
properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 10 at 11:34AM CST until January 10 at 12:15PM CST by NWS Tulsa OK
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a

* Tornado Warning for...
Southwestern Delaware County in northeastern Oklahoma...
Southeastern Mayes County in northeastern Oklahoma...
East central Wagoner County in northeastern Oklahoma...
Northwestern Cherokee County in east central Oklahoma...

* Until 1215 PM CST.

* At 1134 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm with strong low level
rotation that could produce a tornado at any time was located 6
miles north of Sequoyah State Park, moving northeast at 30 mph.

HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed.
Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree
damage is likely.

* Locations in or near the path include...
Wagoner...                        Locust Grove...
Salina...                         Hulbert...
Leach...                          Peggs...
Rose...                           Sportsmen Acres Community...
Sequoyah State Park...            Lost City...
Murphy...                         Snowdale State Park...
properties.instruction:
TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest
floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a
mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter
and protect yourself from flying debris.

CMAMtext: NWS: TORNADO WARNING in this area til 12:15 PM CST. Take shelter now. Check media.
